title: Crowning
data:
You may be **crowned** as a result of [prayer](/wiki/Prayer "Prayer") if you are at least piously [aligned](/wiki/Alignment_record "Alignment record") and extremely [lucky](/wiki/Luck "Luck"). Crowning[\[1\]](#cite_note-1) involves receiving a title, an additional [skill slot](/wiki/Skill_slot "Skill slot"), several [intrinsic](/wiki/Intrinsic "Intrinsic") resistances, and possibly a gift, at the cost of a greatly increased [prayer timeout](/wiki/Prayer_timeout "Prayer timeout").

[ ]

## Contents

- [1 Title](#Title)

- [2 Intrinsics](#Intrinsics)

- [3 Crowning gift](#Crowning_gift)

- [4 Exceptions](#Exceptions)

- [5 Unrestricting weapon skills](#Unrestricting_weapon_skills)

- [6 Avoiding crowning](#Avoiding_crowning)

- [7 Prayer timeout](#Prayer_timeout)

- [8 Messages](#Messages)

- [9 History](#History)

- [10 Variants](#Variants)

  - [10.1 SLASH'EM](#SLASH.27EM)
  - [10.2 dNetHack](#dNetHack)
  - [10.3 FIQhack](#FIQhack)

- [11 References](#References)

## Title

Which title you receive depends on your current alignment:

| Alignment | Title            |
| --------- | ---------------- |
| Lawful    | Hand of Elbereth |
| Neutral   | Envoy of Balance |
| Chaotic   | Glory of Arioch  |

## Intrinsics

The following [intrinsics](/wiki/Property "Property") are granted[\[2\]](#cite_note-2):

- cold resistance
- fire resistance
- poison resistance
- sleep resistance
- shock resistance
- see invisible

## Crowning gift

Regardless of anything else that happens, you will always unrestrict the skill slot for either long sword (if lawful or neutral) or broadsword (if chaotic). Then, the crowning gift is chosen according to either your role (if Wizard or Monk) or your alignment:

- Wizard[\[3\]](#cite_note-3)

  - If not wielding [Vorpal Blade](/wiki/Vorpal_Blade "Vorpal Blade") or [Stormbringer](/wiki/Stormbringer "Stormbringer"), and not carrying a [spellbook of finger of death](/wiki/Spellbook_of_finger_of_death "Spellbook of finger of death"), the gift is a blessed spellbook of finger of death.
  - Otherwise, fall through to alignment-based gift.

- Monk[\[4\]](#cite_note-4)

  - If not wielding an [artifact](/wiki/Artifact "Artifact") or carrying a [spellbook of restore ability](/wiki/Spellbook_of_restore_ability "Spellbook of restore ability"), the gift is a blessed spellbook of restore ability.
  - Otherwise, fall through to alignment-based gift.

- Lawful[\[5\]](#cite_note-5)
  - If wielding a non-artifact long sword (as a primary weapon if using [two-weaponing](/wiki/Two-weapon "Two-weapon")) and [Excalibur](/wiki/Excalibur "Excalibur") does not exist in the game, the long sword is changed into Excalibur.

- Neutral[\[6\]](#cite_note-6)
  - [Vorpal Blade](/wiki/Vorpal_Blade "Vorpal Blade") is gifted, unless it already exists.

- Chaotic[\[7\]](#cite_note-7)
  - If [Stormbringer](/wiki/Stormbringer "Stormbringer") does not exist yet, it is given as a gift.

Afterwards, the gift (if a weapon) is blessed, increased to [+1](/wiki/Enchantment "Enchantment") if below that, and made [unrusted and rustproof](/wiki/Erosion "Erosion"). If no gift is given, or the gift is a spellbook for a known spell,[\[8\]](#cite_note-8) these bonuses are applied to your wielded weapon instead, and the corresponding skill is unrestricted.

## Exceptions

If you already have the crowning gift or it was an artifact that has already been generated in your game, then you do not receive a gift object. The message depends on what you are wielding: "You feel unworthy" if nothing,[\[9\]](#cite_note-9) "Your Vorpal Blade goes snicker-snack!"[\[10\]](#cite_note-10) for neutrals wielding [Vorpal Blade](/wiki/Vorpal_Blade "Vorpal Blade"), or your weapon "hums ominously!"[\[11\]](#cite_note-11) for chaotics wielding [Stormbringer](/wiki/Stormbringer "Stormbringer").

If you want to use crowning to unrestrict an arbitrary weapon skill, you must wield your weapon of choice and your alignment gift must already exist. If you are a [Monk](/wiki/Monk "Monk") or [Wizard](/wiki/Wizard "Wizard"), you can also unrestrict your wielded weapon skill if you are given a spellbook as a gift and you already know the spell. Note, however, that a monk wielding an artifact will not receive a spellbook as a gift, and instead receive their alignment-based gift (if possible). This also applies to a wizard wielding Stormbringer or Vorpal Blade, but as you always unrestrict the skill for your alignment's standard gift, it is less likely to be an issue.

For characters who already have the crowning weapon and that proficiency, crowning is usually a bad deal. But firstly, [foodless](/wiki/Foodless "Foodless") heroes might want the intrinsics. Secondly, you can unrestrict any weapon of your choice if you are wielding it and arrange not to get a crowning gift (or already know the spellbook). Elven non-wizards don't need the gift because they can [force Stormbringer](/wiki/Stormbringer#Obtaining "Stormbringer") to be their first [sacrifice](/wiki/Sacrifice "Sacrifice") gift.

## Unrestricting weapon skills

If your character [class](/wiki/Class "Class") is restricted from using #enhance for a [skill](/wiki/Skill "Skill") in a chosen weapon class, crowning can be a way to "unrestrict" that skill, allowing you to #enhance the skill from Unskilled to Basic. This would allow any class (e.g. Wizard) to use a [saber](/wiki/Saber "Saber") like [Grayswandir](/wiki/Grayswandir "Grayswandir") without the -4 to-hit penalty of being unskilled.

To unrestrict a skill, you must carefully prepare before crowning, including obtaining any possible crowning gifts. For example, lawful characters must ensure Excalibur already exists, while neutrals must procure Vorpal Blade, and chaotics must obtain Stormbringer. In addition, Wizards must have the [spellbook of finger of death](/wiki/Spellbook_of_finger_of_death "Spellbook of finger of death"), and monks must have the [spellbook of restore ability](/wiki/Spellbook_of_restore_ability "Spellbook of restore ability") for Monks. If your god sees that you already have the gifts they otherwise would give AND you are wielding a weapon from a class you are restricted in, you will be unrestricted in that weapon's class; such skills cannot be unrestricted further than Basic.

## Avoiding crowning

There are three ways to avoid being crowned:

- Pray only when in [trouble](/wiki/Prayer#When_to_pray_for_help "Prayer") and not at an [altar](/wiki/Altar "Altar").
- Make sure your [Luck](/wiki/Luck "Luck") is no higher than nine.
- Keep your [alignment record](/wiki/Alignment_record "Alignment record") under 19, which you can easily check if you have a [stethoscope](/wiki/Stethoscope "Stethoscope").

## Prayer timeout

The downside of getting crowned is that the player's [prayer timeout](/wiki/Prayer_timeout "Prayer timeout") is greatly increased, permanently. Players that depend heavily on prayer may find themselves crowned earlier than those that do not, by sheer statistics. Unfortunately, it is these players that are hurt by being crowned, as the increased prayer timeout means they must go longer without praying. If the player does not need the benefits listed above, being crowned is not necessary, though ascending with a title is a nice aesthetic bonus.

It is possible to compensate for the increased prayer timeout by making a large number of sacrifices.

## Messages

- "I crown thee... The Hand of Elbereth!"

  You, a lawful character, were crowned.

- "Thou shalt be my Envoy of Balance!"

  You, a neutral character, were crowned.

- "Thou art chosen to steal souls for My Glory!"

  You, a chaotic character, were crowned and were gifted Stormbringer or already wielding it.

- "Thou art chosen to take lives for My Glory!"

  You, a chaotic character, were crowned but not gifted Stormbringer and not wielding it.

## History

Crowning is introduced in [NetHack 1.3d](/wiki/NetHack_1.3d "NetHack 1.3d") - in this version, a crowned hero gains [invisibility](/wiki/Invisibility "Invisibility"), see invisible, fire resistance, cold resistance, and poison resistance. From this version to [NetHack 2.3e](/wiki/NetHack_2.3e "NetHack 2.3e"), a crowned hero is always declared the "Hand of Elbereth".

The additional skill slot granted for crowning is introduced in [NetHack 3.6.0](/wiki/NetHack_3.6.0 "NetHack 3.6.0").[\[12\]](#cite_note-12)

## Variants

Prior to NetHack 3.6.0, no additional [skill slot](/wiki/Skill_slot "Skill slot") was granted upon crowning. By extension, this is also the case in most variants based on NetHack 3.4.3 and earlier versions.

### SLASH'EM

In [SLASH'EM](/wiki/SLASH%27EM "SLASH'EM"), if a [lawful](/wiki/Lawful "Lawful") character is crowned, their wielded weapon is enchanted to +3 instead of +1, or given additional +1 if already at +3 or above. The item is not at risk of being destroyed.

### dNetHack

In [dNetHack](/wiki/DNetHack "DNetHack"), the player's [Luck](/wiki/Luck "Luck") stat needs to be at least 11 for crowning to happen. Because this requires a non-cursed [luckstone](/wiki/Luckstone "Luckstone") in open inventory, players can avoid crowning by putting the luckstone away before praying. Also, crowning will happen as soon as the player has fulfilled all of the requirements and has completed the quest by presenting the artifact to the quest leader. There are also quite a few more titles the player may receive.

### FIQhack

Crowning also grants intrinsic acid resistance and permanent knowledge of your role's [special spell](/wiki/Special_spell "Special spell"). Since this would make the crowning gift redundant for a monk, their crowning gift is now a [magic marker](/wiki/Magic_marker "Magic marker").

==History==
Crowning is introduced in [[NetHack 1.3d]] - in this version, a crowned hero gains [[invisibility]], see invisible, fire resistance, cold resistance, and poison resistance. From this version to [[NetHack 2.3e]], a crowned hero is always declared the "Hand of Elbereth".

The additional skill slot granted for crowning is introduced in [[NetHack 3.6.0]].{{refsrc|pray.c|862|version=NetHack 3.6.0|comment=Additional skill slot}}

==Variants==
Prior to NetHack 3.6.0, no additional [[skill slot]] was granted upon crowning. By extension, this is also the case in most variants based on NetHack 3.4.3 and earlier versions.

===SLASH'EM===
In [[SLASH'EM]], if a [[lawful]] character is crowned, their wielded weapon is enchanted to +3 instead of +1, or given additional +1 if already at +3 or above. The item is not at risk of being destroyed.

===dNetHack===
In [[dNetHack]], the player's [[Luck]] stat needs to be at least 11 for crowning to happen. Because this requires a non-cursed [[luckstone]] in open inventory, players can avoid crowning by putting the luckstone away before praying. Also, crowning will happen as soon as the player has fulfilled all of the requirements and has completed the quest by presenting the artifact to the quest leader. There are also quite a few more titles the player may receive.

===FIQhack===
Crowning also grants intrinsic acid resistance and permanent knowledge of your role's [[special spell]]. Since this would make the crowning gift redundant for a monk, their crowning gift is now a [[magic marker]].
